trans-unit.source: Represents a CDATA section.
CDATA sections are used to quote or escape blocks of text to keep that text from being interpreted as markup language.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlCDataSection"></xref> class.
<xref:System.String> that contains character data.
<xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> object.
Creates a duplicate of this node.
`CloneNode` serves as a copy constructor for nodes.
To see how this method behaves with other node types, see the <xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.CloneNode%2A> method in the `XmlNode` class.
The cloned node has no parent (<xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.ParentNode%2A> returns `null`).

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to clone only the node itself.
Because CDATA nodes do not have children, regardless of the parameter setting, the cloned node will always include the data content.
The cloned node.
Gets the local name of the node.
For CDATA nodes, the local name is <xref uid="langword_csharp_#cdata-section" name="#cdata-section" href=""></xref>.
Gets the qualified name of the node.
For CDATA nodes, the name is <xref uid="langword_csharp_#cdata-section" name="#cdata-section" href=""></xref>.
Gets the type of the current node.
The node type.
For CDATA nodes, the value is XmlNodeType.CDATA.
Gets the parent of this node (for nodes that can have parents).
The <xref uid="langword_csharp_XmlNode" name="XmlNode" href=""></xref> that is the parent of the current node.
If a node has just been created and not yet added to the tree, or if it has been removed from the tree, the parent is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
For all other nodes, the value returned depends on the <xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.NodeType*> of the node.
The following table describes the possible return values for the <xref uid="langword_csharp_ParentNode" name="ParentNode" href=""></xref> property.
Gets the text node that immediately precedes this node.
Returns <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNode"></xref>.
Saves the children of the node to the specified <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>.
Because CDATA nodes do not have children, `WriteContentTo` has no effect.
This method is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).
The <xref uid="langword_csharp_XmlWriter" name="XmlWriter" href=""></xref> to which you want to save.
Saves the node to the specified <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>.
This method is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).
The <xref uid="langword_csharp_XmlWriter" name="XmlWriter" href=""></xref> to which you want to save.
